channel.title: About on Stéphanie Challita
channel.description: Recent content in About on Stéphanie Challita

item.title: About
item.description: About Me "Everything you can imagine is real." -- Pablo Picasso I am Associate Professor of Software Engineering at University of Rennes 1. I teach at the engineering school ESIR and I am a member of DiverSE research team, which is joint to CNRS, Inria Rennes - Bretagne Atlantique and Irisa. Until September 2020, I was a Postdoctoral Researcher at I3S laboratory & Inria Sophia Antipolis – Méditerranée in France, within the Kairos research team.

item.title: Activities
item.description: Activities Activities @IEEE Computer Society Member of IEEE Conference Activities Committee (CAC). Journals Assistant Editor of the Journal of Software and Systems Modeling, Springer (SoSyM). Conferences Organizing Committees Student Volunteers Co-Chair @ICT4S’2023 Publication Chair @ICSA’2021 Program Co-Chair @FAACS’2020 (co-located with ECSA’2020 Publicity Co-Chair @ECSA’2020 Student Volunteers Co-Chair @ECSA’2019 Communications Chair @FormaliSE’2019 (co-located with ICSE’2019 Conferences & Workshops Program Committees PC Member @ECMFA’2025 PC Member @ICSR’2024 PC Member @SATrends’2024 (co-located with ICSE’2024) PC Member @ICSR’2022 PC Member @SLE’2021-Artifact Evaluation Track PC Member @MODELS’2021-Tools & Demonstrations Track PC Member @Models@runtime’2021 (co-located with MODELS’2021) PC Member @MLE’2021 (co-located with MODELS’2021) PC Member @FAACS’2021 (co-located with ECSA’2021) PC Member @ICSA’2021-Artifact track PC Member @ICSA’2021-ECR track) PC Member @FormaliSE’2021 (co-located with ICSE’2021) PC Member @SA-TTA’2021 (part of SAC’2021) PC Member @MODELS’2020-Demo Track PC Member @FAACS’2019 (co-located with ECSA’2019) PC Member @SERVICE COMPUTATION’2018 External Reviewing Services JoT, IEEE Access, CCPE & SPE journals IEEE/ACM MobileSoft’2017 IEEE WCNC’2018 Session Chair Services ICSA’2021 FAACS’2020 CLOSER’2018 CLOUD’2017 CLOSER’2017 Collaborative projects SPAI (2018 - 2023) OCCIware (2014 - 2017) Talks Seminar in 2020 @ENS Rennes (see the slides here) GLE/LOUISE/RIMEL working day 2019 organized by GDR GPL PechaKucha @FormaliSE’2018 (see the slides here) TED speech @IEEE WISC’2018 Most of my slides are available on my Slideshare account .

item.title: Positions
item.description: Positions M2 internships positions Automated reverse-engineering of a Cloud API DSML for design, orchestration and adaptation of microservices PhD positions No position avalaible

item.title: Prog1
item.description: Matériel de cours - Programmation - ESIR Professeurs : Stéphanie Challita, Hélène Feuillâtre, Fabrice Lamarche, Paul Temple, Jolan Philippe, Manel Chehibi Cours Les slides du cours sont disponibles ici. Plan du cours : Cours Semaine Date Heure Thème Notes Semaine 42 15/10/2024 13:15 - 14:45 Rappel de programmation Programmes, Syntaxe, Variables, Structures de contrôles Semaine 42 15/10/2024 15:00 - 16:30 Classes et Objets Concepts de classes et d’objets, attributs, méthodes, instances, etc.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Publications All my publications are available on Google Scholar . You can also access all the articles from HAL . PhD Thesis Stéphanie Challita “Inferring Models from Cloud APIs and Reasoning over Them: A Tooled and Formal Approach.” Defended on December 21, 2018 in Lille, France. (see the slides here) International Journals Anne Bumiller, Stéphanie Challita, Benoit Combemale, Olivier Barais, Nicolas Aillery, Gaël Le Lan.

item.title: Research
item.description: Research Overall, my research project aims to facilitate and improve software development. For this, I am interested in the development of Domain-Specific Modeling Languages which have shown their effectiveness in the world of software development, thanks to a set of features such as abstraction, verification, code generation and many others. More specifically, my research aims to provide languages and tools to model, verify and ease software development of heterogeneous distributed systems like Cloud Computing.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Teaching 2020 - Present I teach many courses related to software engineering at ESIR (Ecole Supérieure d’Ingénieurs de Rennes) attached to University of Rennes 1. I am mainly responsible of the object-oriented programming and web development courses. ESIR1-SI (S5) > Object-Oriented Programming in Java (PROG1) ESIR2-SI (S7) > Web Development 2020 - 2021 I taught courses related to software modelling and to software development tools. ESIR2-SI (S7) > V&V ESIR2-SI (S8) > MDI 2020 During my postdoc, I was responsible of teaching a course (28 hours) related to systems and networks administration at the IUT, attached to University of Côte d’Azur.

item.title: Web
item.description: Matériel de cours - Programmation Web - ESIR Professeurs : Stéphanie Challita, Hélène Feuillâtre &amp Charly Reux Cours Les slides du cours de Dev Backend sont disponibles ici. Les slides du cours de Dev Frontend sont disponibles ici. Plan du cours : Cours (partie Backend) Date Heure Thème Notes 12/11/2024 09:45 - 11:15 Introduction et Généralités Histoire, vision globale, architecture, frontend, backend, TypeScript et NestJS 14/11/2024 09:45 - 11:15 Object Relationnal Mapping (ORM) Comment passer du monde objet au monde relationel des BDDs 15/11/2024 09:45 - 11:15 Object Relationnal Mapping (ORM) Comment passer du monde objet au monde relationel des BDDs 18/11/2024 11:30 - 13:00 TypeORM et OpenAPI Framework ORM pour TS, REST, bonnes pratiques et standard OpenAPI 19/11/2024 09:45 - 11:15 TypeORM et OpenAPI Framework ORM pour TS, REST, bonnes pratiques et standard OpenAPI 25/11/2024 09:45 - 11:15 Sécurité Sécurisation d’API, de mots de passe, HTTPs, Autorisation & Authentification 28/11/2024 11:30 - 13:00 Extra Backend Dev Vendre son API, Développement No-code Séances de TP Le sujet du projet (partie Backend) est disponible sur GitHub ici.
